item.title: 英特尔股价暴跌恐将侵蚀特朗普力挺的复苏势头
item.description: 英特尔股价的下跌，正让特朗普总统关于由美国企业领衔快速重振国内芯片制造业的愿景面临现实考验。此前四个月，美国政府曾试图收购该公司高达10%的股权。【原文：Intel Corp.’s stock slide is delivering a reality check to President Donald Trump’s vision for quickly reviving domestic chip manufacturing led by an American champion, four months after the US moved to acquire as much as a 10% stake in the company.】

item.title: 里德尔的市场支持与美联储计划被视为对主席职位的助力
item.description: 据熟悉白宫决策过程的人士透露，里克·里德在华尔街的资历以及对美联储改革持开放态度的立场，已为其角逐央行最高职位增添了砝码。【原文：Rick Rieder’s Wall Street bona fides and openness to making changes at the Federal Reserve have bolstered his candidacy for the central bank’s top job, according to people familiar with the White House deliberations.】

item.title: 巴拉圭央行意外降息25个基点
item.description: 巴拉圭央行意外将基准利率下调0.25个百分点至5.75%，理由是通胀预期趋稳且消费物价增速放缓。【原文：Paraguay’s central bank unexpectedly cut the benchmark interest rate a quarter point to 5.75%, citing anchored inflation expectations and slowing consumer prices.】

item.title: Meta与依视路陆逊梯卡因智能眼镜专利案遭起诉
item.description: 在智能眼镜领域持续领跑的Meta Platforms公司，近日因专利侵权遭到另一家眼镜制造商起诉。该诉讼同时将视力保健巨头依视路陆逊梯卡公司及其旗下奥克利品牌列为被告。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc., the reigning leader in the growing smart glasses category, is being sued by another glasses maker over patent infringement in a case that also targets eyewear giant EssilorLuxottica SA and its Oakley subsidiary.】

item.title: 对冲基金交易蓬勃发展，得益于互换利差的飙升
item.description: 交易员正纷纷重返一种热门对冲基金策略，该策略押注美国国债将跑赢利率互换。【原文：Traders are piling back into a popular hedge fund strategy that bets on US Treasuries outperforming interest rate swaps.】

item.title: 明星人工智能研究员新实验室估值达40亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，著名人工智能研究员理查德·索彻正就为一家名为Recursive的新创公司筹集数亿美元资金进行谈判，该公司致力于构建更先进的人工智能系统。【原文：Famed artificial intelligence researcher Richard Socher is in talks to raise hundreds of millions of dollars for a new startup called Recursive that’s focused on building more advanced AI systems, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴克莱认为市政债券市场上涨空间受高估值限制
item.description: 据巴克莱银行策略师称，市政债券市场持续跑赢大盘的势头可能已所剩无几。【原文：The muni market’s outperformance streak likely has little room left to run, according to Barclays Plc strategists.】

item.title: 这本该是个绝佳的市场，可惜无人交易。
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读本期通讯，这里汇集了Odd Lots世界每日精选内容。有时是我们——乔·韦森塔尔和特蕾西·阿洛威——为您解读市场、金融与经济领域的最新动态；有时则是来自专家嘉宾和信息源网络的深度贡献。无论内容如何，我们保证始终精彩纷呈。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉投资者面临法律雷区，因美国调整立场
item.description: 有意参与白宫振兴委内瑞拉石油经济计划的投资者，可能因外交承认问题陷入政治与法律的雷区。【原文：Investors who want to take part in the White House’s plans to revitalize Venezuela’s oil-based economy are at risk of stepping into a political and legal minefield over diplomatic recognition.】

item.title: 软件制造商Databricks敲定18亿美元融资方案
item.description: 软件制造商Databricks公司已从广泛的银团贷款投资者和私募信贷机构处筹集到18亿美元的新融资。【原文：Software maker Databricks Inc. has lined up $1.8 billion of new financing from broadly syndicated loan investors and private credit lenders.】

item.title: 私募信贷交易失利引发利益冲突法庭之争
item.description: 行星网络公司原以为已敲定一笔5000万美元的私人信贷协议，用于资助这家光纤互联网公司高成本进军纽约哈德逊河谷地区。然而其创始人如今表示，某私募股权公司以贷款为诱饵窃取其商业机密，同时其竞争对手正试图抢占该地区市场。【原文：Planet Networks Inc. thought it had landed a $50 million private credit deal to finance the fiber internet company’s expensive push into New York’s Hudson Valley. Instead, its founder now says a private equity firm dangled the loan to access his trade secrets while its own competing startup tried to swoop into the region.】

item.title: 太平洋投资管理公司旗下至少60只基金去年12月购入哥伦比亚本地债券
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司管理的至少60只基金上月参与了哥伦比亚的私募发行，大量购入当地债务，帮助政府为其激增的赤字融资。【原文：At least 60 funds managed by Pacific Investment Management Co. were involved in a private placement with Colombia last month, scooping up local debt and helping the government finance its exploding deficit.】

item.title: 债券波动率消退，动荡一周以小幅波动收场
item.description: 本周早些时候撼动金融市场的动荡已从规模达30万亿美元的国债市场中消散，令交易员们对波动率从历史低位反弹的期望落空。【原文：The turbulence that rattled financial markets earlier this week has vanished from the $30 trillion Treasury market, quashing traders’ hopes for a rebound in volatility from historic lows.】

item.title: 智利铜矿供应增长尚需时日，矿业委员会发出警告
item.description: 智利矿业委员会警告称，智利新政府的促进增长议程或将推动新增铜供应，但任何实质性增产仍需数年才能实现。【原文：The pro-growth agenda of Chile’s incoming government could bring forward new copper supply, but any meaningful production increase will still take years to materialize, Chile’s Mining Council warned.】

item.title: 智能戒指制造商Oura据悉计划以25%折扣发起要约收购
item.description: 知情人士透露，热门智能戒指制造商Oura Health Oy正计划以低于最新融资轮的价格向现有投资者发起要约收购，此举将使其能够更长时间保持私有化状态。【原文：Oura Health Oy, the maker of popular smart rings, is working on a tender offer for existing investors at a discount to its latest funding round, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that will allow it to stay private for longer.】

item.title: 美国石油市场开始感受到冬季风暴中断的影响
item.description: 席卷美国大部分地区的严寒天气正开始冻结石油和天然气井，威胁到从北达科他州到得克萨斯州的产油区。【原文：Frigid weather sweeping across much of the US is starting to freeze oil and natural gas wells, threatening to disrupt production from North Dakota to Texas.】

item.title: 欧洲企业高管离开达沃斯论坛，警告欧洲必须整顿自身，否则将败给美国和中国
item.description: 无论是在制药、人工智能还是国防领域，本周出席达沃斯世界经济论坛的高管们都向欧洲发出了严厉警告：要么整顿好内部事务，要么就输给美国和中国。【原文：Whether it’s in pharmaceuticals, artificial intelligence, or defense, executives attending the World Economic Forum in Davos this week had a stark warning for Europe: Get your house in order or lose out to the US and China.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯考虑出售罗特埃尔德业务部门30%股权
item.description: 知情人士透露，蒂森克虏伯集团正考虑出售旗下罗特埃尔德轴承业务约30%的股权，该交易可能使该资产估值达到约15亿欧元（18亿美元）。【原文：Thyssenkrupp AG is considering the sale of a roughly 30% stake in its Rothe Erde bearings business, people familiar with the matter said, in a deal that could value the asset at about €1.5 billion ($1.8 billion).】

item.title: 全球动荡推动避险资产需求，白银价格突破100美元大关
item.description: 白银价格首次突破每盎司100美元大关，延续了此前的强劲涨势。这波涨势源于避险资产需求的激增，以及从上海到纽约等零售市场掀起的疯狂抢购热潮。【原文：Silver topped $100 an ounce for the first time, extending a scorching rally built on surging demand for haven assets and frenzied buying in retail markets from Shanghai to New York.】

item.title: 全球最佳股市涨势吸引外国投资者涌入巴西
item.description: 巴西股市本周上演惊人涨势，当地基准股指创下历史新高，成为全球表现最佳的股市。随着投资者将数千亿美元资金从美国资产转向发展中国家，巴西股市因此脱颖而出。【原文：A stellar rally in Brazil sent the local equity benchmark to a record this week, turning it into the world’s best-performing stock market as investors rotate billions away from US assets and into the developing world.】

item.title: 美国监管机构称放宽银行规则将抑制私人信贷需求
item.description: 货币监理署表示，该机构为银行放宽危机后杠杆贷款规则的举措，将有助于贷款机构与私营信贷行业竞争。【原文：The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency said the agency’s efforts to relax post-crisis leveraged-loan rules for banks will help lenders compete with the private credit industry.】

item.title: DoorDash与优步未能阻止纽约小费法生效
item.description: DoorDash公司和优步科技公司未能阻止纽约市一项法律生效，该法律要求在结账时向顾客提供小费选项，该法律将于下周开始实施。【原文：DoorDash Inc. and Uber Technologies Inc. lost a bid to block a New York City law requiring a tipping option be presented to customers at checkout from going into effect next week.】

item.title: 黑石、凯雷考虑入股印度顶级板球队
item.description: 黑石集团和凯雷集团正与印度亿万富豪竞相收购该国最成功职业板球联赛的球队股权，押注这项运动在世界增长最快的经济体之一日益高涨的人气。【原文：Blackstone Inc. and Carlyle Group Inc. are jostling with billionaires in India to buy stakes in teams in the country’s most successful professional cricket league, betting on the surging popularity of the sport in one of the fastest-growing economies.】

item.title: 美国消费者信心指数大幅攀升，升至五个月高点
item.description: 1月份美国消费者信心指数升至五个月高点，因美国民众对经济和个人财务状况的乐观情绪增强。【原文：US consumer sentiment increased to a five-month high in January as Americans grew more optimistic about the economy and their finances.】

item.title: 荷兰养老金管理公司ABP在2025年削减了120亿美元的美国国债持仓
item.description: 欧洲最大的养老基金去年大幅削减了对美国国债市场的投资敞口。【原文：Europe’s biggest pension fund spent much of last year dramatically scaling back its exposure to the US government bond market.】

item.title: 美国商业活动小幅回升，但招聘依然疲软
item.description: 美国企业在新年的开局阶段，经营活动仅略有改善，这使得对劳动力的需求受到抑制。【原文：US businesses kicked off the new year with only a slight improvement in activity, keeping a lid on demand for workers.】

item.title: 美国股市在动荡一周后收跌；英特尔因财报下滑
item.description: 美国股市在震荡行情收盘时小幅下挫，标普500指数连续第二周下跌。投资者在经历地缘政治噪音爆发后重新调整策略，将注意力转向企业盈利和货币政策。【原文：US equities slipped at the close of a volatile stretch that’s set the S&P 500 up for its second straight weekly decline as investors recalibrated, turning their attention back to earnings and monetary policy after a burst of geopolitical noise.】

item.title: 黑石集团支持的徕卡相机公司考虑以10亿欧元出售
item.description: 知情人士透露，徕卡相机公司（Leica Camera AG）的股东正考虑出售这家德国相机制造商的控股权，该交易估值可能达到约10亿欧元（12亿美元）。【原文：Leica Camera AG’s owners are considering a sale of a controlling stake in the German camera maker, which could be valued at about €1 billion ($1.2 billion) in a deal, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 并非所有人都认同卡尼对破碎世界的看法
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普竭力在达沃斯占据主导地位。但可以说，加拿大总理引发了人们最深的思考。【原文：Donald Trump did his best to dominate Davos. But arguably Canada’s premier got people thinking most.】

item.title: 瑞银撤回对西门子能源的看跌预测，因其股价已飙升165%
item.description: 在对西门子能源公司给出"卖出"评级近一年后，瑞银集团对这家欧洲表现最佳的大型股之一转为看涨。【原文：Almost exactly a year after slapping a sell rating on Siemens Energy AG, UBS Group AG has turned positive on one of Europe’s best-performing largecaps.】
